All the styles you need to properly format content typically entered into a CMSâ€™s rich text editor. More often you will find this kind of content in an `<article>` tag.

## Headings

Our headings are based on the [type scale](/docs/style/type/typescale.html) set for Open Sans.

<Canvas isColumn>
  <h1>Heading 1</h1>
  <h2>Heading 2</h2>
  <h3>Heading 3</h3>
  <h4>Heading 4</h4>
  <h5>Heading 5</h5>
  <h6>Heading 6</h6>
</Canvas>

## Page content

Text here about headings and flowing page content.

**Example:**
<Canvas isColumn>
  <h1>Page heading (h1)</h1>
  <p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Etiam ut quam tristique neque tincidunt fermentum. Etiam in odio non erat porta vulputate a id neque. Fusce id neque fermentum, consectetur ex facilisis, accumsan lectus.</p>
  <h2>Section heading (h2)</h2>
  <p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Etiam ut quam tristique neque tincidunt fermentum. Etiam in odio non erat porta vulputate a id neque. Fusce id neque fermentum, consectetur ex facilisis, accumsan lectus.</p> 
  <h3>Sub-section (h3)</h3>
  <h4>Sub-section (h4)</h4>
  <h5>Sub-section (h5)</h5>
</Canvas>

Display headings

</Canvas>
